html:
** Cloud security platform's DDOG.O shares up 2% at $148.5 premarket

** DDOG enters into a partnership with Amazon.com's AMZN.O cloud division, Amazon Web Services (AWS), to build and deliver tighter product alignment between both cos (Full Story)

** Co says deeper product alignment will enhance customers' visibility into their cloud infrastructure as well as improve security

** Collaboration will reveal opportunities for joint marketing and co-selling programs, says Matt Garman, senior vice president of sales and marketing at AWS

** Up to last close, stock had fallen ~13% since it last reported results on Nov. 4 and rose ~66 last year


(Reporting by Akash Sriram in Bengaluru)

(( Akash.Sriram@thomsonreuters.com ;))
